thread.title: Raiders sign Jack Del Rio to new 4-year contract
thread.title_full: Raiders sign Jack Del Rio to new 4-year contract

author: Joe Rodgers (joseph.rodgers@peformgroup.com)
title: Raiders sign Jack Del Rio to new 4-year contract
text:
February 10, 2017 8:42pm EST February 10, 2017 8:26pm EST American Football, News, English, Khalil Mack, Derek Carr, NFL, Oakland Raiders The Raiders went 12-4 last season and made the playoffs for the first time since 2002. Jack Del Rio (Getty Images) 
Updated at 8:42 p.m. ET 
Updated at 8:42 p.m. ET 
After leading the Raiders to a 12-4 season and their first playoff appearance since the 2002 season, head coach Jack Del Rio has been rewarded with a new four-year contract, the team announced Friday. 
"The Raiders have torn up Jack Del Rioâ€™s original contract and rewarded him with a new four-year deal," owner Mark Davis said in a statement. "We are excited to continue building on the strong foundation that has been established and this is a significant step in achieving that goal." 
MORE: Coaches pay for Falcons' collapse 
Del Rio went 7-9 in his first season in Oakland but enjoyed success with the emergence of third-year players, quarterback Derek Carr and pass rusher Khalil Mack, who was named the 2016 Defensive Player of the Year. 
Before Oakland, Del Rio spent nine seasons with the Jaguars, going 12-4 in 2005. The Jags went 8-8 the next season, followed by an 11-5 campaign. 
Del Rio will have a new offensive coordinator in Todd Downing, replacing Bill Musgrave, but will retain defensive coordinator Ken Norton Jr. Watch This
